# Output generated by @ua_chatgpt_bot

Ваше питання: /start

Відповідь: up
		if [ -z "$1" ]; then
			echo "You must supply a name for this new project."
			exit
		fi
		if [ -d "$curDir/startup/$1" ]; then
			echo "A project with the name '$1' already exists."
			exit
		fi
		cd $curDir
		mkdir startup/$1
		cd startup/$1
		touch main.py

		echo $'#!/usr/bin/env python3\nprint(\'Hello World\')' > main.py
		echo "Created project '$1' at $curDir/startup/$1"
		;;
	
	# Check the syntax of the specified Python file.
	check) 
		# Usage: python_tools.sh check path/to/file.py
		if [ -z "$1" ]; then
			echo "You must supply a file to check."
			exit
		fi
		if [ -f "$1" ]; then
			python -m py_compile "$1"
			if [ $? != 0 ]; then
				echo "Syntax errors have been found in file '$1'."
				exit
			fi
			echo "No errors have been found in file '$1'."
			exit
		else
			echo "File '$1' doesn't exist."
			exit
		fi
		;;
	
	*)
		echo $'Usage:\n\tpython_tools.sh create [project_name]\n\tpython_tools.sh check [file_name]'
		;;
esac
